title: One killed, another injured in shooting in Panadura
byline: A 35-year-old person has been killed while another was injured in a shooting incident that took place in Hirana, Panadura.

title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that the Intertropical Convergence Zone, where winds from the Northern Hemisphere and Southern Hemisphere converge, affects the island’s weather.

title: Public and semi-govt sector employment in Sri Lanka tops 1.15 million
byline: The number of employees in all public and semi-government sector institutions in Sri Lanka has exceeded 1,156,018.

title: Postal voting for 2025 LG Election ends today
byline: The marking of postal votes for the 2025 Local Government (LG) Election is scheduled to end today (29).

title: Vesak ‘Dansal’ must be registered before 9 May, guidelines issued
byline: The Sri Lanka Public Health Inspectors’ Union has announced that the registration of ‘Dansal’ for the upcoming Vesak season has commenced.

title: Carney’s Liberal party wins Canadian election and completes a stunning turnaround fueled by Trump
byline: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s Liberal Party won Canada’s federal election on Monday, capping a stunning turnaround in fortunes fueled by U.S. President Donald Trump’s annexation threats and trade war.

title: Ex-President Maithripala appears before SC over Royal Park pardon
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena has appeared before the Supreme Court this morning (29), as per a notice issued on him for the hearing of a Fundamental Rights (FR) petition filed in connection with the presidential pardon granted to the Royal Park murder convict.

title: Chief Govt Whip Nalinda claims he is saving Rs. 7.4 mn monthly for govt
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa says the incumbent government is making significant efforts to curb wasteful expenditure, claiming that he alone has contributed to monthly savings of Rs. 7.4 million in his capacity as the Chief Government Whip.

title: 30 injured in bus accident in Beliatta
byline: A head-on collision between a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus and a private bus in Beliatta has resulted in injuries to at least 30 individuals.

title: Body of person suspected to have died 8 months ago found in Kesbewa
byline: A decomposed human remains, suspected to be of a person who died about eight months ago, has been discovered inside a house in Kesbewa.

title: Pardon for Royal Park murder convict: Maithripala pays Rs. 1 mn in compensation
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena has completed the payment of a sum of Rs. 1 million as compensation ordered by the Supreme Court, following his decision to grant a presidential pardon to Jude Shramantha Jayamaha, who was sentenced to death in the Royal Park murder case.

title: 2025 LG Election campaigning to end at midnight on 3 May
byline: All campaign activities related to the 2025 Local Government (LG) Election are scheduled to end at midnight on 3 May, the National Election Commission has announced.

title: India shuts over half of Kashmir tourist spots in security review
byline: More than half of the tourist destinations in India’s insurgency-torn Kashmir region have been closed to the public from Tuesday, according to a government order reviewed by Reuters, in a bid to tighten security after last week’s attack on holiday-makers.

title: President to leave for Vietnam on state visit on May 3
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to leave for Vietnam on a state visit on 3 May, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Sri Lanka moves to introduce new legal framework for SOE management
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted its policy approval for the State-Owned Enterprises (SOEs) Management Draft Bill prepared in order to introduce a new legal framework for the proper management and maintenance of State-Owned Enterprises.

title: Cabinet nod to conduct Economic Census under two phases
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to conduct an Economic Census in two stages: in 2025 for agricultural activities and in 2026 for non-agricultural activities.

title: Climber rescued from Mount Fuji twice in one week
byline: Authorities in Japan have rescued the same climber from the slopes of Mount Fuji twice in the space of a week.

title: CBSL presents Financial Statements and Operations Report 2024 to President
byline: The Financial Statements and Operations Report 2024 of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka has been officially handed over to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat today.

title: Canada Election: PM Carney’s ruling Liberals win minority government
byline: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney’s Liberals retained power in the country’s election on Monday (Apr 28), but fell short of the majority government he had wanted to help him negotiate tariffs with US President Donald Trump.

title: State Vesak Festival to be held in Nuwara Eliya
byline: This year’s State Vesak Festival is scheduled to be held in Nuwara Eliya, as decided by the government.

title: Former SLTB Vice Chairman arrested by CID
byline: Former Vice Chairman of the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) L.A. Wimalaratne has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Which finger gets marked when voting at this election?
byline: Voters will have their little finger of the left hand marked with an appropriate sign to prevent double voting and ensure transparency during the upcoming Local Government (LG) election, the National Election Commission has stated.

title: Father of two sentenced to life in prison for heroin possession
byline: A 37-year-old father of two was sentenced to life imprisonment by the Colombo High Court today (29) after being found guilty for the possession and trafficking of 6.95 grams of heroin.

title: Govt to award new appointments in supplementary medicine service before end of May
byline: Steps have been taken to release the results of the examination held to fill positions of Medical Laboratory Technologists and Physiotherapists under the Supplementary Medicine Services within two weeks, Minister of Health Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa confirmed.

title: Committee probing Deshabandu Tennakoon meets for third time
byline: The Committee of Inquiry appointed to inquire and report its findings on Inspector General of Police (IGP) T. M. W. Deshabandhu Tennakoon in respect of acts of gross abuse of power, has met for the third time at the Parliamentary premises.

title: Weather advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: Thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur in several areas in the Eastern, Uva, Central, North-Central, Northern, and Sabaragamuwa provinces, as well as in the Kurunegala District, the Department of Meteorology warns.

title: Jackie Chan to be honoured with career achievement award at Locarno Film Festival 2025
byline: The Locarno Film Festival will honor Jackie Chan with a lifetime career award honoring the martial arts master who helped define Hong Kong action cinema before becoming a Hollywood mainstay.

title: New satellite will see through clouds to ‘weigh’ Earth’s forests
byline: A first-of-its-kind satellite due to launch on Tuesday will be able to see through clouds and leafy canopies to assess how the world’s rainforests are protecting the planet from climate change.

title: 22 people killed, 3 injured in restaurant fire in China
byline: Chinese authorities say 22 people have been killed and 3 injured in a fire at restaurant in the northern city of Liaoning.

title: Former SLTB Vice Chairman granted bail
byline: The former Vice Chairman of the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB), L.A. Wimalaratne, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), has been released on bail.

title: Colombo is beautiful with its religious and cultural diversity - PM Harini
byline: Colombo is beautiful with its religious and cultural diversity, and therefore, the residents should unite and transform the area into the most beautiful city, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has stated.

title: LPL franchises ‘Colombo Strikers’ and ‘Jaffna Kings’ terminated
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) has announced that it has terminated the Lanka Premier League (LPL) franchise partnerships of the Colombo Strikers and Jaffna Kings.

title: PM Harini should’ve met US Vice President Vance to discuss tariffs –Ranil
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya should’ve sought a meeting with the Vice President of the United States, J.D. Vance who was in India recently to discuss the reciprocal tariffs announced by President Donald Trump, Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has asserted.

title: PM Harini should’ve met US Vice President Vance to discuss tariffs – Ranil
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya should have sought a meeting with the Vice President of the United States, J.D. Vance, who was in India recently to discuss the reciprocal tariffs announced by President Donald Trump, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has asserted.

title: Batalanda Commission Report handed over to AG
byline: The report of the Commission of Inquiry into the alleged establishment and operation of illegal detention centres and torture chambers in the ‘Batalanda’ Housing Scheme has been handed over to the Attorney General.

title: One of the world’s largest container ships arrives at Colombo Port
byline: One of the world’s largest container ships, MSC MARIELLA, has arrived at the East Container Terminal of the Colombo Harbour for operational activities, marking a significant milestone in Sri Lanka’s maritime history.

title: TISL welcomes drop in election violations, urges President to uphold democratic values
byline: Transparency International Sri Lanka (TISL) says it observes a notable reduction in violations of election laws during the current local government election period, as indicated by reports and press releases issued by the Election Commission.

title: Sri Lanka should restore cost-recovery electricity pricing as soon as possible: IMF
byline: International Monetary Fund (IMF) Sri Lanka Mission Chief Evan Papageorgiou says Sri Lanka should restore cost-recovery electricity pricing as soon as possible to minimise fiscal risk and is essential to complete the fourth review of the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) program.

title: Govt. holds special discussion on pensioners’ salary disparities
byline: A special discussion was held today (April 29) between the National Organisation for the Protection of Retirees’ Rights and the Minister of Labour and Deputy Minister of Economic Development Dr. Anil Jayantha Fernando, along with Deputy Minister of Labor Mahinda Jayasinghe.

title: Ready to revise Sri Lanka bailout after US tariffs: IMF
byline: The International Monetary Fund on Tuesday offered to revise the terms of a $2.9 billion bailout loan to cash-strapped Sri Lanka, should the United States reinstate punitive tariffs on exports.
